messages.message:
Anyone have a few minutes to jump on a zoom call with me, to figure out a weird python3-related problem? The tl;dr is the docker image now builds with py3, but when I try to run it, it fails with this error:
```
  File "/instabase/workers/celery-webdriver-tasks/py/instabase/registry/tasks.py", line 42, in <module>
    from instabase.nlp_utils.nlp_process import NLPProcessor
  File "/instabase/workers/celery-webdriver-tasks/py/instabase/nlp_utils/nlp_process.py", line 19, in <module>
    from instabase.fetcher_utils.downloader.generic import download_html, get_text_from_html_document
  File "/instabase/workers/celery-webdriver-tasks/py/instabase/fetcher_utils/downloader/generic.py", line 32, in <module>
    from instabase.fetcher_utils.downloader.goose_lite import extract_article
  File "/instabase/workers/celery-webdriver-tasks/py/instabase/fetcher_utils/downloader/goose_lite.py", line 7, in <module>
    from goose.article import Article  # type: ignore
ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'goose'
```
but if I `docker run -it` the image and check with `pip`, it shows `goose3` as being installed correctly. And loading the python REPL, I can load goose with the same logic that `instabase/fetcher_utils/downloader/generic.py` uses. So I’m kinda scratching my head…
We can zoom (if you have a zoom room) or slack call or whatever is most convenient/easiest for you

mint instabase is inviting you to a scheduled Zoom meeting.

Adding those PY3 guards fixed me right up, @Chetan. Thanks again!
